title: 112_s2048
content: SECTION 1. TAX REPORTING FOR LIFE SETTLEMENT TRANSACTIONS. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to add a new section requiring returns for certain life insurance contract transactions. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code mandates reporting of payments in life insurance contract transactions, including details of the parties involved, sale date, contract issuer, and payment amounts. Furnishing a written statement to recipients is also required. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code requires reporting of seller's basis in life insurance contracts, including seller's information, investment in the contract, and transfer to a foreign person. Issuers of life insurance contracts must make a return with these details as prescribed by the Secretary. Additionally, every person who makes a payment of reportable death benefits during any taxable year must make a return setting forth the name, address, and TIN of the person. Amendments to section 6724 include new clause (xxvi) for returns relating to certain life insurance contract transactions. The Internal Revenue Code now requires reporting of seller's basis in life insurance contracts, including seller's information, investment in the contract, and transfer to a foreign person. Section 6050X exempts certain life insurance contract transaction information from reporting requirements under section 6047. Effective December 31, 2012, amendments apply to reportable policy sales and death benefits. SEC. 2 amends section 1016(a) of the Internal Revenue Code regarding tax basis of life insurance contracts, specifying deductions for taxes, carrying charges, and reasonable charges under annuity or life insurance contracts. Effective date is after August 25, 2009. SEC. 3 provides an exception to transfer for valuable consideration rules. SEC. 3 provides an exception to valuable consideration rules for commercial transfers of life insurance contracts, defining a reportable policy sale as an acquisition of an interest in a life insurance contract without a substantial relationship with the insured. The amendments made by this section apply to transfers after December 31, 2012, involving a partnership, trust, or entity holding an interest in a life insurance contract. A conforming amendment expands the scope of section 101(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
